title: Ticket #1080: Handle * packaging using CPack for cmake branch
description:
Handle all the packaging senarios and hit all install targets for created elements.

Open item: Manual?
remarks:
2009-Dec-21 14:34:19 by tstclair:
This will include NMI support, build and submission scripts.

2010-Jan-22 15:18:39 by tstclair:
Thawan had mentioned the idea of performing "out-of-source" builds. It was rather low priority for me atm, but it makes source packaging a lot simpler. This is meant to record that information, and if he has time and wishes to pursue, that would be great.

2010-Feb-11 16:59:37 by kooburat:
Add the following modules
  1. FindLinuxPlatform - Detect Linux distribution name
  2. PackageDate - Generate current date for dynamic generation of changelog

The following feature in this commit

  1. Add RPM packaging on Redhat-compatible platform
  2. Add more installation targets for backstage files such as examples and release_notes

2010-Feb-15 20:26:02 by kooburat:
  1. Add Debian packaging code
    1. This require patched versions of CPack in order to run properly
    2. In order to create package with proper file owner, fakeroot make package should be invoked
    3. This code is tested with PROPER build but I have to manually install most of the externals into my system because Debian's default is not compatible.
  2. Replace FindLinuxPlatform with SystemSpecificInformations module
    1. This is a custom module written by one of the CPack developers, I found this in the mailing list
    2. It can detect OS name and version of both Linux and Windows and I modify part of it to fit my needs
  3. Minor modification to RPM packaging code
    1. This require patched versions of CPack in order to run properly
    2. There will be no duplicate entries in %file section of SPEC file

2010-Mar-17 11:33:37 by tstclair:
This is pretty much complete. I still need to merge back some recent changes in WiX but other then that it should be done.
